instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS: What is PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS? This is PPBUS_G3H after passing through a current sense resistor that splits it off from the rest of PPBUS_G3H. The purpose of this is so that we can measure how much current is flowing to this part of the machine..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no boot
threads.message:
Hi,

I have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A that has no power.
I have green light but no fan spin and no usb activity.

On <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> i only have 1.1V, and <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> pins 14 and 29, also have 1.1V on <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>.
<CHIP>U7501</CHIP> EN has 3.4V

Can you help?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no boot
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no boot
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no boot
threads.message:
You don't have <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and complain the board doesn't turn on???
Find why is not present.
Start checking in diode mode.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no boot
threads.message:
Hi,
But I have  <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>  8.57V. Don't understand

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no boot
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no boot
threads.message:
Hi,
you're right. I have a blown cap <CAPACITOR>C7583</CAPACITOR>, and the trace of it has gone. I've made a jumper from <TRANSISTOR>Q7560</TRANSISTOR> to <CAPACITOR>C7581</CAPACITOR>, but still doesn't work, and I can't find any other broken trace. <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> still has 0.9V on pin 23.
<TRANSISTOR>Q7560</TRANSISTOR> has 8.57V on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS</SIGNAL>

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no boot
threads.message:
OK, .  you're right I've made a jumper from <TRANSISTOR>Q7560</TRANSISTOR> to <CAPACITOR>C7500</CAPACITOR>, and now it works.
It seams a broken trace inside the board. Is there any better way to "wire" those, besides passing a cable all the board extension to the other side?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no boot
threads.message: Search on the same side other power rails derivated from <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no boot
